Welcome to TheLife App Smart Evangelism Toolbox

You want to help your friends discover Jesus, but every person, and every journey, is different.

Our goal is to help you walk with your friends on their journey towards Jesus.

At each step of the journey, we\'ll supply personalised resources, conversation ideas, and other tools which will help you connect your friends to God in meaningful ways.

We understand that evangelism is hard. Without a like-minded community, it\'s easy to lose our motivation to live missionally.

To keep motivated and active, we recommend you use TheLife App Smart Evangelism Toolbox with a group of like-minded Christians so you can encourage and pray for one another on the journey.

The Process

Beginning a relationship with Jesus is radically life-changing. For most people, the process involved in knowing and embracing Jesus is like a journey that travels through different stages.

Based on the work of authors Don Everts and Doug Schaupp in their book, I Once Was Lost: What postmodern skeptics taught us about their path to Jesus, TheLife App uses five thresholds, or turning points to describe the stages a person confronts on their journey to Jesus:

  1. Knowing and trusting a Christian
  2. Becoming curious about Jesus/Christianity
  3. Opening up to change
  4. Seeking God (in Christ Jesus)
  5. Entering the kingdom

These five stages are not a magic formula nor do they always occur in order but they do help us understand the journey and process involved in our friendâ€™s lives as they journey towards Jesus.

Knowing and trusting a Christian

The first step is to develop trust with your friend.

In our society, many people distrust Christians -- either because of their prejudices, or often because of our own actions.

When faced with different beliefs, we often get defensive, act offended, argue, or even judge people. These reactions kill trust.

That\'s not to say that these differences aren\'t important -- just that our reactions to them are important too.

At each threshold, we\'ll suggest activities to help your friend take the next step.

Reading the category descriptions can also help you understand what your friend\'s needs are at a given threshold.

Becoming curious about Jesus

In a postmodern or post-Christian society, many people are indifferent to Jesus.

They\'ve heard just enough to be convinced he has nothing to offer them, or they think he\'s no different than any religious leader.

Now\'s the time to break their preconceptions about Jesus, and to show them he\'s the most compelling person in history.

As much by words as by actions, we want to show that Jesus\' message is like no other.

The unexpected ways he spoke and lived blew people away, and the astonishing ways he leads us to live, really pique peoples\' curiosity.

Stories, parables, acts of service, and profound questions are some great tools to spark curiosity.

But be careful: it\'s easy to drown curiosity. If we start answering unasked questions or preaching, we may lose our friend\'s interest, and their trust.

Opening up to change

The third threshold, opening up to change, is the hardest. Imagine realising that a different way of living may be better than your own.

It means questionning your whole vision of the world, and facing your deepest dissatisfactions and disappointments in life.

It\'s a personal revolution.

And it can be as hard for us to walk through it with a friend as it is for them.

To help, we can model openness ourselves, and look together at life\'s disappointments. At the right moment, a clear challenge to openness can be key.

Don\'t forget, patience is essential. Persevere in friendship and love, regardless of your friend\'s decision. And keep praying.

Seeking God

The next step is to start intentionally seeking God: to transition frm a passive receptivity to an active examination of Jesus.

Someone who\'s open to change may already feel like he\'s seeking. But being open to whatever may come isn\'t going to bring a conclusion.

To help her start seeking, authentically live your relationship with God in front of her. Invite her in, and show her how He changes you.

Share your struggles, your joys, your times of prayer. Study the scriptures together.

Let her feel that it\'s ok to explore. Keep the emphasis on helping her learn for herself, not on receiving content.

Some of these things may feel weird or uncomfortable to you, but they\'ll do a world of good.

Your friend is going way beyond her comfort zone already, so she\'ll be encouraged to see you do the same.

Entering the Kingdom

Jesus said, "Seek and ye shal find." In His ministry, he regularly called people to make a decision about Him -- to find Him.

If we don\'t help a friend move beyond seeking, he may grow weary and give up. This creates an urgencey at threshold five.

A clear call to decide is the culmination of the journey. As much as thresholds two and three require patience, here, clarity is key.

Your friend may not respond right away to a call, but this provides a great chance to address roadblocks together.

As you talk it through, keep the focus on Jesus rather than on secondary issues.

Finally, be prepared for spiritual warfare. As souls approach the Kingdom, Satan will fight to keep them out.

Persevere in prayer and the power of the Holy Spirit. And get ready to party.

Beyond threshold 5

For a new believer, getting established in their new faith is integral.

The resources here are intended to build the foundations of their new relationship with God.

But perhaps the most important thing you can do for a new believer is to get them connected to a local church.

Walk through one of these studies together, and maybe even invite another friend to join you!

Getting Started

Now that you\'ve added a friend, we need to assign them to a threshold.

Click the "What\'s Next" button at any threshold for suggested next actions.

Here, you\'ll only have the option to change the threshold, or to read about how to identify thresholds.
